article.headline: Furman 67, Elon University 60
article.story: ELON, N.C. (AP) -- Scottie Rice made four 3-pointers and scored 20 points to help Elon beat Furman 67-60 on Monday night. Jackson Atoyebi also scored 11 points and grabbed six rebounds for the Phoenix (8-13, 3-6 Southern Conference), who outrebounded Furman 32-25 in winning their third straight game. Robby Bastain led the Paladins (11-9, 3-6) with 13 points and five assists and Maleye Ndoye had 12 points and eight rebounds. The two teams were tied at 33 late in the first half but then Ryan Jones had a layup and Rice made a 3-pointer to give Elon a five-point lead at halftime. Bostain had a free throw to get the Paladins within 61-60 with 1:04 left in the game but Elon's Matt Nowlin had four free throws and Cameron Kirby had a layup to provide the final margin. The Phoenix made 7-of-10 free throws in the second half to hold off Furman. Montell Watson also passed for six assists for Elon.
